docs.lead_paragraph: With just months until the state's assisted suicide law goes into effect, the California Medical Association has issued guidelines to doctors on writing prescriptions of lethal doses of medication for terminally ill patients.

headline.main: Guidelines Issued for California's Assisted Suicide Law
headline.print_headline: Guidelines Issued for California's Assisted Suicide Law

docs.snippet: With just months until the state's assisted suicide law goes into effect, the California Medical Association has issued guidelines to doctors on writing prescriptions of lethal doses of medication for terminally ill patients.

docs.lead_paragraph: A study finds that pharmaceutical companies have cut drug prices in response to political pressure.

headline.main: Even Talking About Reducing Drug Prices Can Reduce Drug Prices
headline.print_headline: Even Talking About Drug Prices Can Slow Their Rise

docs.abstract: The Upshot; research shows that political talk about reining in drug prices can itself help reduce cost, even if legislation does not emerge; pharmaceutical stocks have declined since Democratic politicians, including presidential hopefuls and Pres Obama, have turned their attention to issue, trend that could encourage firms to lower prices.
docs.snippet: A study finds that pharmaceutical companies have cut drug prices in response to political pressure.

docs.lead_paragraph: The drug was being tested on healthy volunteers in a licensed private institution specializing in clinical trials, the health minister said.

headline.main: 6 Hospitalized, One of Them Brain-Dead, After Drug Trial in France
headline.print_headline: 6 Hospitalized After a Drug Trial Goes Awry

docs.snippet: The drug was being tested on healthy volunteers in a licensed private institution specializing in clinical trials, the health minister said.

byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris, Katie Thomas from New York and Andrew Pollack from San Francisco.

docs.lead_paragraph: The system the Food and Drug Administration uses to keep data on drugs after they have come to market is incomplete, outdated and often inaccurate, federal investigators said.

headline.main: F.D.A. Faulted for Problems With Drug Tracking
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Faulted on Tracking Drug Problems

docs.abstract: Government Accountability Office report finds Food and Drug Administration has flaws in process it uses to track drugs after they go on market, which raises concerns about agency's efficacy as main drug overseer in country.
docs.snippet: The system the Food and Drug Administration uses to keep data on drugs after they have come to market is incomplete, outdated and often inaccurate, federal investigators said.
